subject: Re: [junit] Re: Request, RunnerBuilder, Computer and @RunWith
msgSnippet: Kristian, You re right.  There should indeed be a better way to do this. Interceptors have proven an impressively good model for modifying the behavior of test
messageBody:
Kristian,

You're right. There should indeed be a better way to do this.
Interceptors have proven an impressively good model for modifying the
behavior of test methods, and a reasonable model for class
interceptors is coming to mind. Imagine this:

@RunWith(Suite.class)
@SuiteClases({A.class, B.class, C.class...})
public class ABCSuite {
@ClassInterceptor Parallelize parallelize = Parallelize.classesAndMethods();
}

One line to do what you want (although an unwieldy line at that...)

Would that do the trick?

David Saff

On Thu, Jun 18, 2009 at 11:39 PM, krosenvold<kristian@...> wrote:
> Oh, sorry for not providing any good context here ;)
>
> My real goal is to get parallelization of *any* sort running within maven2. This is because our automated build uses it; if I was able to get parallel test-methods it'd cut the run-time of our long-running builds to about a third. If I could get classes too I'd probably aim for world-record swamping of our 16-core build server ;) Reducing wall-clock execution time of all our builds is a priority concern.
>
> For our daily work we use IntelliJ idea v8, and while certainly "nice to have" the value of parallel tests in the development environment is less glaringly obvious.
>
> I was looking around in the git-snapshot of junit-4.7 code, trying to determine how/if I could do this. It seems to me like there's two basic approaches as to how to achieve this:
>
> To get parallelization for classes you need to mess around with the runner. I'm not totally familiar/comfortable with how this would be done.
>
> For parallel methods it seems like one *should* be able to specify a "Computer" on the "@RunWith" annotation; it even seems like a logical configuration point for this information.
>
> I know this may be slightly off-topic, but I feel several "tensions" in the code-base around the "Computer". Is this still largely work in progress?
>
> Kristian
